General information

Source: vignettes/general-information.Rmd
general-information.Rmd
library(humind)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(tidyr)

This vignette emphasizes how to add indicators for the “main” dataset at the household-level. The package provides functins to add, recode, and prepare the usual humanitarian composite indicators as well as the ones that are specific to the MSNA analytical framework.

main <- dummy_raw_data$main |> as_tibble()
roster <- dummy_raw_data$roster |> as_tibble()

Recategorize demographic variables

Head of household - final values 

# Recategorize the head of household variable
main <- add_hoh_final(main)

# Print results
main |> select(resp_gender, resp_age, resp_hoh_yn, hoh_gender, hoh_age) |> drop_na()
#> # A tibble: 204 × 5
#>    resp_gender resp_age resp_hoh_yn hoh_gender hoh_age
#>    <chr>          <dbl> <chr>       <chr>        <dbl>
#>  1 male             118 yes         male           118
#>  2 male              33 yes         male            33
#>  3 pnta              40 yes         pnta            40
#>  4 pnta              74 no          other           70
#>  5 female            65 yes         female          65
#>  6 pnta              97 yes         pnta            97
#>  7 female            95 no          male            35
#>  8 pnta              73 no          pnta           119
#>  9 pnta              58 yes         pnta            58
#> 10 pnta              45 no          other           30
#> # ℹ 194 more rows

Age variables 

# Cateogize age of the respondent
main <- add_age_cat(main, "resp_age")
main <- add_age_18_cat(main, "resp_age")

# Do the same for the individuals
roster <- add_age_cat(roster, "ind_age")
roster <- add_age_18_cat(roster, "ind_age")

# Print results for the loop
roster |> select(ind_age, ind_age_cat, ind_age_18_cat, ind_age_18_cat_d)
#> # A tibble: 816 × 4
#>    ind_age ind_age_cat ind_age_18_cat ind_age_18_cat_d
#>      <dbl> <chr>       <chr>                     <dbl>
#>  1      15 (10,15]     below_18                      0
#>  2      52 (50,55]     above_18                      1
#>  3      84 (80,85]     above_18                      1
#>  4      49 (45,50]     above_18                      1
#>  5      13 (10,15]     below_18                      0
#>  6     115 NA          above_18                      1
#>  7     107 NA          above_18                      1
#>  8      96 (95,100]    above_18                      1
#>  9      46 (45,50]     above_18                      1
#> 10     120 NA          above_18                      1
#> # ℹ 806 more rows
